title: Sundar Pichai On Why Google Invests So Heavily On Free Meals To Employees
content: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has revealed why the company invests so heavily in its famous free meal policy. Contrary to popular belief, Mr Pichai explained these meals were not just perks, adding they served a deeper purpose.
summary: Google CEO Sundar Pichai has revealed why the company invests so heavily in its famous free meal policy. Contrary to popular belief, Mr Pichai explained these meals were not just perks, adding they served a deeper purpose.

title: Do Academics Respond More To Mails From "Melissa" Or "Rahul"? Study Says...
content: A new research shows Australian academics responded differently to potential PhD students, depending on whether they were called "Melissa" or "Rahul".
summary: A new research shows Australian academics responded differently to potential PhD students, depending on whether they were called "Melissa" or "Rahul".

title: Sunil Bharti Mittal Heard Own AI Voice. It Asked For Large Fund Transfer

title: Wall Street Journal Sues Perplexity AI For Copyright Infringement

title: NDTV World Summit: Vibrant Market For Carbon Credits Soon?

title: In South Korea, A New Way To Buy Groceries: "Flying Shopping Cart"
content: South Korean researchers have developed a transport drone flying on multiple flexible rotors that self-correct to stay level in flight and can be used as a "flying shopping cart" to carry goods over uneven terrain such as stairs.
summary: South Korean researchers have developed a transport drone flying on multiple flexible rotors that self-correct to stay level in flight and can be used as a "flying shopping cart" to carry goods over uneven terrain such as stairs.

title: 2 Men, Accused Of Killing Air India Bombing Suspect, Plead Guilty
content: Two men accused of killing Ripudaman Singh Malik, a Sikh man acquitted in the tragic 1985 Air India Kanishka terrorist bombing case, have pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in a Canadian court, according to media reports.
summary: Two men accused of killing Ripudaman Singh Malik, a Sikh man acquitted in the tragic 1985 Air India Kanishka terrorist bombing case, have pleaded guilty to second-degree murder in a Canadian court, according to media reports.

title: Harvey Weinstein Diagnosed With Bone Marrow Cancer: Report

title: 59 People In Hong Kong Tricked Into Undressing During Video Chats
content: According to the police, the scam typically involves extortionists - often women - luring male victims into undressing during video chats and then secretly recording the acts.
